uk.ac.aber.dcs.blockmotion.model

Interface IFootage

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    IFootageClass

    public interface IFootage
    Represents the animation footage. You must implement this with a class. YOU MUST NOT CHANGE THIS INTERFACE!
    Version:
    1.0, 14th March 2017
    Author:
    Chris Loftus

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods

      void add(IFrame f)
      Adds a new frame to the footage increasing the num frames by one

      Get the given frame

      Get the number frames that make up the footage
      int getNumRows()
      Get the number of rows that make up a frame in the footage
      void load(java.lang.String fn)
      Load the frames from the given file
      void save(java.lang.String fn)
      Save the footage to the given file
      void transform(TransformerSuperClass t)
      Undertake a transformation on every frame in the footage

      • getNumFrames

        int getNumFrames()
        Get the number frames that make up the footage
        Returns:
        the number of frames

      • getNumRows

        int getNumRows()
        Get the number of rows that make up a frame in the footage
        Returns:
        the number of frame rows.

      • getFrame

        IFrame getFrame(int num)
        Get the given frame
        Parameters:
        num - the position of the frame starting from 0
        Returns:
        the frame
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if frame num does not exist

      • add

        void add(IFrame f)
        Adds a new frame to the footage increasing the num frames by one
        Parameters:
        f - the frame to add
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if f is null

      • load

        void load(java.lang.String fn)
   throws java.io.IOException
        Load the frames from the given file
        Parameters:
        fn - the file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if the file cannot be opened, e.g. it does not exist

   throws java.io.IOException
        Save the footage to the given file
        Parameters:
        fn - the file name
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if the file cannot be created or saved to.
